snippet: Far from the nation’s fields of wheat and corn, more than 18,000 people who live in the 54 largest American cities received millions in farm subsidies last year, a report finds.
abstract: Report released by Environmental Working Group finds that more than 18,000 people who live in the 54 largest American cities received about $24 million in farm subsidies in 2012; such subsidies, known as direct payments, have long been controversial, and were supposed to be eliminated in farms bills introduced in the House and Senate, but were continued when Congress extended the most recent farm bill after efforts to pass a new bill stalled.
lead_paragraph: Far from the nation’s fields of wheat and corn, more than 18,000 people who live in the 54 largest American cities received millions in farm subsidies last year, a report finds.

headline.main: Farm Subsidies for Nonfarmers May Continue as Lawmakers Deadlock Again
headline.print_headline: Farm Subsidies for Nonfarmers May Continue as Lawmakers Deadlock Again
